A foul-smelling, black liquid fills several jagged cracks in the area. Bubbles froth at the surface of the pools, providing the area with a continuous odour. Open roadways extend to the northeast and northwest, travelling deeper into the mountain city. Continuing higher up is Mhaldor Road, no end to its climb in sight. Far below lies the gatehouse to the city, and to the east and west walkways have been outlined by irregular patterns in the ground. Some graffiti has been scrawled here. It reads, "<span class="fore12">Live without the constraints of Virtue and nothing will be denied you.</span>"<span class="fore3"> A small, mhun miner has been nailed upon a ridged, blood stained cross and left to perish. A runic totem is planted solidly in the ground. The cadaverous figure here atop the Idol of Corruption seethes with hatred. A shimmering orb lies here, illuminating the surrounding area with a slight glow. A large school of piranha swims here inside a deep, murky pool. A sewer grate looms darkly beneath your feet. The leather-bound Apocrypha lies closed upon an obsidian pedestal. A small wooden lottery box stands here. There are 20 ominous liches here. There are 10 infernal wraiths here. There are 10 naga assassins here. The hideous form of Mhaldorus, the colossal daemon gazes down at you with utter disgust. A sigil in the shape of a small, rectangular </span><span class="fore12">monolith</span><span class="fore3"> is on the ground. Wings folded against his back, Xi'vyar, an infernal cerberus, stands here silent and still. Standing still as a statue, a blood steed has fixed its fiery red </span><span class="fore12">eye</span><span class="fore3">s on some movement in the distance. A ruby-encrusted chest with a lining of crimson silk is here. An onyx bench is here.</span><span class="fore10"> Blade Savant </span><span class="fore12">Opponent</span><span class="fore10"> Vallah, Squire of Mhaldor is here, shrouded.</span><span class="fore6"> You may ENTER SUBDIVISION from here. </span><span class="fore11">You see exits leading northeast, east (open door), west (open door), northwest, up, and down. </span><span class="fore2">3784h, 2988m, The smell of burned and rotten eggs floats thick in the air. The rock of this cavern is damp, and fat stalagmites stand here like dripping candles made of stone. In the centre of the cave is a large pool of water, made from a raised mound of stone with a bowl shaped depression. Within the water, there is motion, as the water is stirred by an unseen force within. Periodic bubbles emerge from a vent in the stone, barely visible through the murky water. The water itself seems fresh, but the bubbles emitted by the spring carry the stench that fills the area.<span class="fore3"> A runic totem is planted solidly in the ground. The smell of burned and rotten eggs floats thick in the air. The rock of this cavern is damp, and fat stalagmites stand here like dripping candles made of stone. In the centre of the cave is a large pool of water, made from a raised mound of stone with a bowl shaped depression. Within the water, there is motion, as the water is stirred by an unseen force within. Periodic bubbles emerge from a vent in the stone, barely visible through the murky water. The water itself seems fresh, but the bubbles emitted by the spring carry the stench that fills the area.<span class="fore3"> A rune like a lightning bolt has been sketched into the ground here. A runic totem is planted solidly in the ground. Standing still as a statue, a blood steed has fixed its fiery red </span><span class="fore12">eye</span><span class="fore3">s on some movement in the distance. A jet-black falcon glides just above, looking for prey. A stone gargoyle flies overhead on leathery, grey wings. A stinking noxious cloud floats here. The smell of burned and rotten eggs floats thick in the air. The rock of this cavern is damp, and fat stalagmites stand here like dripping candles made of stone. In the centre of the cave is a large pool of water, made from a raised mound of stone with a bowl shaped depression. Within the water, there is motion, as the water is stirred by an unseen force within. Periodic bubbles emerge from a vent in the stone, barely visible through the murky water. The water itself seems fresh, but the bubbles emitted by the spring carry the stench that fills the area.<span class="fore3"> A rune like a lightning bolt has been sketched into the ground here. A runic totem is planted solidly in the ground. Standing still as a statue, a blood steed has fixed its fiery red </span><span class="fore12">eye</span><span class="fore3">s on some movement in the distance. A jet-black falcon glides just above, looking for prey. A stone gargoyle flies overhead on leathery, grey wings. A stinking noxious cloud floats here. Your stomach becalms itself. <span class="fore14">2641h, </span><span class="fore12">467m, </span><span class="fore2">17494e, 13223w </span>cexkdb-<span class="fore2"> (</span><span class="fore15">illness</span><span class="fore9"> -</span><span class="fore2">)</span><span class="fore14">l </span><span class="fore6">Stinking springs. </span>The walls here echo with the sound of running water, a disconcertingly cheery sound in this grim cavern. The smell of burned and rotten eggs floats thick in the air. The rock of this cavern is damp, and fat stalagmites stand here like dripping candles made of stone. In the centre of the cave is a large pool of water, made from a raised mound of stone with a bowl shaped depression. Within the water, there is motion, as the water is stirred by an unseen force within. Periodic bubbles emerge from a vent in the stone, barely visible through the murky water. The water itself seems fresh, but the bubbles emitted by the spring carry the stench that fills the area.<span class="fore3"> A rune like a lightning bolt has been sketched into the ground here. A runic totem is planted solidly in the ground. Standing still as a statue, a blood steed has fixed its fiery red </span><span class="fore12">eye</span><span class="fore3">s on some movement in the distance. A jet-black falcon glides just above, looking for prey. A stone gargoyle flies overhead on leathery, grey wings. A stinking noxious cloud floats here. Hands of rotting flesh and white bone push up from the ground.</span><span class="fore10"> Blade Savant </span><span class="fore12">Opponent</span><span class="fore10"> Vallah, Squire of Mhaldor is here, shrouded. In the centre are three round pools, each brimming with black fluid, slopping at the edges but never overflowing. Each ring flickers with energy, and periodically the black fluid clears to show an empty room, a dark grove, or even combat. Here spectators may sit and view the action within the colossal arena.<span class="fore3"> There are 5 </span><span class="fore12">monolith</span><span class="fore3"> sigils here. many collapsing corridors through the ancient stone, this one is crawling with spiders that search out prey with tiny glowing red <span class="fore12">eye</span>s. The ground crunches underfoot from the desiccated carcasses littering the floor. The thousands of arachnid denizens of the caves here have left their mark. Skeletal warriors stand careful guard here, still clad in their flawlessly shining armour. Axes hang from belts on the bony guardsmen, never again to be swung.<span class="fore3"> A runic totem is planted solidly in the ground. A stone gargoyle flies overhead on leathery, grey wings. </span><span class="fore11">You see exits leading north, northeast, and east. </span><span class="fore2">3784h, 3178m, 17818e, 13800w </span>cexkdb-<span class="fore14">ne </span><span class="fore6">Portal tower. </span><span class="fore3">A small, well polished metal plaque is mounted on the base of a nightmarish statue. An ornate mirror stands here, its silver face reflecting cold light. </span><span class="fore11">You see exits leading northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest, and down. </span><span class="fore2">3784h, 3178m, 17818e, 13800w </span>cexkdb-<span class="fore14">l </span><span class="fore6">Portal tower. </span>Standing in silent contrast to the wrack and ruin all around, this stone tower radiates power and vitality. The granite blocks are perfectly formed and flawlessly joined together. No mortar weds the blocks, they are held together by their sheer weight. The tower is a squat cylinder, topped with a simple parapet. No windows mar the perfect smooth walls.<span class="fore3"> A small, well polished metal plaque is mounted on the base of a nightmarish statue. A statue of Valnurana, Mother of the Nightmare, stands here, radiating grief and horror. An ornate mirror stands here, its silver face reflecting cold light. A stone gargoyle flies overhead on leathery, grey wings. </span><span class="fore11">You see exits leading northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest, and down. </span><span class="fore2">3784h, 3178m, 17818e, 13800w </span>cexkdb-<span class="fore14">say letum </span><span class="fore11">You say, "Letum." </span>As you utter the command, the air about the mirror begins to shimmer. <span class="fore2">3784h, 3178m, 17820e, 13800w </span>cexkdb- Tendrils of blackness spew forth from the surface of the mirror, pulling you beneath its sheen surface. Pain pierces your mind. Just as you succumb to the terror, you awake, and you find yourself within a courtyard amidst three towers. You are moved by an iron-rimmed mirror. <span class="fore6">Courtyard. </span><span class="fore3">A statue of a fiendish dragon shelters the courtyard with outspread wings. An ornate mirror stands here, its silver face reflecting cold light. A small, well polished metal plaque is mounted on the base of a fiendish statue. A pool of opaque black water has formed at the foot of the mirror in this room. Standing still as a statue, a blood steed has fixed its fiery red </span><span class="fore12">eye</span><span class="fore3">s on some movement in the distance. A jet-black falcon glides just above, looking for prey. A stinking noxious cloud floats here. Hands of rotting flesh and white bone push up from the ground.</span><span class="fore10"> Blade Savant </span><span class="fore12">Opponent</span><span class="fore10"> Vallah, Squire of Mhaldor is here, shrouded. He wields an ornate steel rapier marred with char marks in each hand. </span><span class="fore11">You see exits leading northeast, south, northwest, and in. </span><span class="fore2">3784h, 3178m, 17820e, 13800w </span>cexkdb- <span class="fore11">Blade Savant </span><span class="fore12">Opponent</span><span class="fore11"> Vallah, Squire of Mhaldor says, "Ready?" </span><span class="fore2">3784h, 3178m, 17820e, 13800w </span>cexkdb- As the stinking gas fills your lungs, you vomit violently. <span class="fore2">3720h, 3178m, 17820e, 13800w </span>cexkdb-(<span class="fore12">-64</span><span class="fore8"> Health</span>)<span class="fore14">laugh </span><span class="fore3">You utter a deep, rumbling laugh. </span><span class="fore2">3720h, 3178m, 17820e, 13800w </span>cexkdb-<span class="fore14">l </span><span class="fore6">Courtyard. </span>Black marble walls stand all around in this spacious courtyard. Banners hung from the pinnacles of towers high above proclaim the Seven Truths of Evil in golden lettering on black. Lower, at <span class="fore12">eye</span> level, tapestries are hung, portraying various scenes in the history of Evil. Here a tapestry shows the Goddess of dreams bound to an iron rack as the Lord of Evil tears Her <span class="fore12">eye</span>s out. There is shown the stalagmite whereupon His followers spilled oceans of blood for His release. One shows the founding of the Naga, with Lord Sartan looking on with malevolent pride. Another shows the founding of the Apostates, Xerimor shown cutting the wings from an angel. Many more show scenes of war and duels fought by the Maldaathi. Again and again, the same faces show. Kaelin eviscerates a Mhun in one, Trunks vivisects an Atavian in another. A newly hung tapestry shows the Night of the Forgebreaker. Hwolf, Orchist, Kaelin, Mistral, Prophecy, and Yig are shown each smashing a shrine to the Smith. Carved in the floor of the courtyard is a black pentagram, which seems to leech the light from the torchlit room.<span class="fore3"> A statue of a fiendish dragon shelters the courtyard with outspread wings. An ornate mirror stands here, its silver face reflecting cold light. A small, well polished metal plaque is mounted on the base of a fiendish statue. A pool of opaque black water has formed at the foot of the mirror in this room. Standing still as a statue, a blood steed has fixed its fiery red </span><span class="fore12">eye</span><span class="fore3">s on some movement in the distance. A jet-black falcon glides just above, looking for prey. A stinking noxious cloud floats here. A stone gargoyle flies overhead on leathery, grey wings. courtyard. Banners hung from the pinnacles of towers high above proclaim the Seven Truths of Evil in golden lettering on black. Lower, at <span class="fore12">eye</span> level, tapestries are hung, portraying various scenes in the history of Evil. Here a tapestry shows the Goddess of dreams bound to an iron rack as the Lord of Evil tears Her <span class="fore12">eye</span>s out. There is shown the stalagmite whereupon His followers spilled oceans of blood for His release. One shows the founding of the Naga, with Lord Sartan looking on with malevolent pride. Another shows the founding of the Apostates, Xerimor shown cutting the wings from an angel. Many more show scenes of war and duels fought by the Maldaathi. Again and again, the same faces show. Kaelin eviscerates a Mhun in one, Trunks vivisects an Atavian in another. A newly hung tapestry shows the Night of the Forgebreaker. Hwolf, Orchist, Kaelin, Mistral, Prophecy, and Yig are shown each smashing a shrine to the Smith. Carved in the floor of the courtyard is a black pentagram, which seems to leech the light from the torchlit room.<span class="fore3"> A rune like a lightning bolt has been sketched into the ground here. A rune like a rising sun has been sketched into the ground here. A statue of a fiendish dragon shelters the courtyard with outspread wings. Banners hung from the pinnacles of towers high above proclaim the Seven Truths of Evil in golden lettering on black. Lower, at <span class="fore12">eye</span> level, tapestries are hung, portraying various scenes in the history of Evil. Here a tapestry shows the Goddess of dreams bound to an iron rack as the Lord of Evil tears Her <span class="fore12">eye</span>s out. There is shown the stalagmite whereupon His followers spilled oceans of blood for His release. One shows the founding of the Naga, with Lord Sartan looking on with malevolent pride. Another shows the founding of the Apostates, Xerimor shown cutting the wings from an angel. Many more show scenes of war and duels fought by the Maldaathi. Again and again, the same faces show. Kaelin eviscerates a Mhun in one, Trunks vivisects an Atavian in another. A newly hung tapestry shows the Night of the Forgebreaker. Hwolf, Orchist, Kaelin, Mistral, Prophecy, and Yig are shown each smashing a shrine to the Smith. Carved in the floor of the courtyard is a black pentagram, which seems to leech the light from the torchlit room.<span class="fore3"> A rune like a lightning bolt has been sketched into the ground here. An ornate mirror stands here, its silver face reflecting cold light. A small, well polished metal plaque is mounted on the base of a fiendish statue. A pool of opaque black water has formed at the foot of the mirror in this room. Banners hung from the pinnacles of towers high above proclaim the Seven Truths of Evil in golden lettering on black. Lower, at <span class="fore12">eye</span> level, tapestries are hung, portraying various scenes in the history of Evil. Here a tapestry shows the Goddess of dreams bound to an iron rack as the Lord of Evil tears Her <span class="fore12">eye</span>s out. There is shown the stalagmite whereupon His followers spilled oceans of blood for His release. One shows the founding of the Naga, with Lord Sartan looking on with malevolent pride. Another shows the founding of the Apostates, Xerimor shown cutting the wings from an angel. Many more show scenes of war and duels fought by the Maldaathi. Again and again, the same faces show. Kaelin eviscerates a Mhun in one, Trunks vivisects an Atavian in another. A newly hung tapestry shows the Night of the Forgebreaker. Hwolf, Orchist, Kaelin, Mistral, Prophecy, and Yig are shown each smashing a shrine to the Smith. Carved in the floor of the courtyard is a black pentagram, which seems to leech the light from the torchlit room.<span class="fore3"> A rune like a lightning bolt has been sketched into the ground here. A rune like a rising sun has been sketched into the ground here. A statue of a fiendish dragon shelters the courtyard with outspread wings. An ornate mirror stands here, its silver face reflecting cold light. A small, well polished metal plaque is mounted on the base of a fiendish statue. A pool of opaque black water has formed at the foot of the mirror in this room. Standing still as a statue, a blood steed has fixed its fiery red </span><span class="fore12">eye</span><span class="fore3">s on some movement in the distance. A jet-black falcon glides just above, looking for prey. A stinking noxious cloud floats here. A stone gargoyle flies overhead on leathery, grey wings. A black, murky mist has settled here. Hands of rotting flesh and white bone push up from the ground.</span><span class="fore10"> Blade Savant </span><span class="fore12">Opponent</span><span class="fore10"> Vallah, Squire of Mhaldor is here, shrouded. Your mind feels stronger and more alert. <span class="fore2">3784h, 3017m, 17820e, 13528w </span>cexkdb-(<span class="fore10">+462</span><span class="fore8"> Mana</span>)<span class="fore14">l </span>You feel an aura of rebounding surround you. <span class="fore2">3784h, 3017m, 17820e, 13528w </span>cexkdb- <span class="fore6">Courtyard. </span>Black marble walls stand all around in this spacious courtyard. Banners hung from the pinnacles of towers high above proclaim the Seven Truths of Evil in golden lettering on black. Lower, at <span class="fore12">eye</span> level, tapestries are hung, portraying various scenes in the history of Evil. Here a tapestry shows the Goddess of dreams bound to an iron rack as the Lord of Evil tears Her <span class="fore12">eye</span>s out. There is shown the stalagmite whereupon His followers spilled oceans of blood for His release. One shows the founding of the Naga, with Lord Sartan looking on with malevolent pride. Another shows the founding of the Apostates, Xerimor shown cutting the wings from an angel. Many more show scenes of war and duels fought by the Maldaathi. Again and again, the same faces show. Kaelin eviscerates a Mhun in one, Trunks vivisects an Atavian in another. A newly hung tapestry shows the Night of the Forgebreaker. Hwolf, Orchist, Kaelin, Mistral, Prophecy, and Yig are shown each smashing a shrine to the Smith. Carved in the floor of the courtyard is a black pentagram, which seems to leech the light from the torchlit room.<span class="fore3"> A rune like a lightning bolt has been sketched into the ground here. A rune like a rising sun has been sketched into the ground here. A statue of a fiendish dragon shelters the courtyard with outspread wings. An ornate mirror stands here, its silver face reflecting cold light. A small, well polished metal plaque is mounted on the base of a fiendish statue. A pool of opaque black water has formed at the foot of the mirror in this room. Standing still as a statue, a blood steed has fixed its fiery red </span><span class="fore12">eye</span><span class="fore3">s on some movement in the distance. A jet-black falcon glides just above, looking for prey. A stone gargoyle flies overhead on leathery, grey wings. A black, murky mist has settled here. A stinking noxious cloud floats here. Hands of rotting flesh and white bone push up from the ground.</span><span class="fore10"> Blade Savant </span><span class="fore12">Opponent</span><span class="fore10"> Vallah, Squire of Mhaldor is here, shrouded. Your stomach becalms itself. <span class="fore2">3768h, </span><span class="fore14">1479m, </span><span class="fore2">17818e, 12967w </span>cekdb-<span class="fore2"> (</span><span class="fore15">illness</span><span class="fore9"> -</span><span class="fore2">)</span><span class="fore14">l </span><span class="fore2">You may drink another health or mana elixir. 3768h, </span><span class="fore14">1479m, </span><span class="fore2">17818e, 12967w </span>cekdb- <span class="fore6">Courtyard. </span>Black marble walls stand all around in this spacious courtyard. Banners hung from the pinnacles of towers high above proclaim the Seven Truths of Evil in golden lettering on black. Lower, at <span class="fore12">eye</span> level, tapestries are hung, portraying various scenes in the history of Evil. Here a tapestry shows the Goddess of dreams bound to an iron rack as the Lord of Evil tears Her <span class="fore12">eye</span>s out. There is shown the stalagmite whereupon His followers spilled oceans of blood for His release. One shows the founding of the Naga, with Lord Sartan looking on with malevolent pride. Another shows the founding of the Apostates, Xerimor shown cutting the wings from an angel. Many more show scenes of war and duels fought by the Maldaathi. Again and again, the same faces show. Kaelin eviscerates a Mhun in one, Trunks vivisects an Atavian in another. A newly hung tapestry shows the Night of the Forgebreaker. Hwolf, Orchist, Kaelin, Mistral, Prophecy, and Yig are shown each smashing a shrine to the Smith. Carved in the floor of the courtyard is a black pentagram, which seems to leech the light from the torchlit room.<span class="fore3"> A rune like a lightning bolt has been sketched into the ground here. A rune like a rising sun has been sketched into the ground here. A statue of a fiendish dragon shelters the courtyard with outspread wings. An ornate mirror stands here, its silver face reflecting cold light. A small, well polished metal plaque is mounted on the base of a fiendish statue. A pool of opaque black water has formed at the foot of the mirror in this room. Standing still as a statue, a blood steed has fixed its fiery red </span><span class="fore12">eye</span><span class="fore3">s on some movement in the distance. A jet-black falcon glides just above, looking for prey. A stone gargoyle flies overhead on leathery, grey wings. A black, murky mist has settled here. Hands of rotting flesh and white bone push up from the ground.</span><span class="fore10"> Blade Savant </span><span class="fore12">Opponent</span><span class="fore10"> Vallah, Squire of Mhaldor is here, shrouded. He wields an ornate steel rapier marred with char marks in each hand. </span><span class="fore11">You see exits leading northeast, south, northwest, and in. </span><span class="fore2">3768h, </span><span class="fore14">1479m, </span><span class="fore2">17818e, 12967w </span>cekdb- You take a drink from an oaken vial. No longer will the sunlight harm you. <span class="fore2">3113h, </span><span class="fore14">2287m, </span><span class="fore2">17820e, 12910w </span>cekdb-<span class="fore2"> (</span><span class="fore15">darkshade</span><span class="fore9"> -</span><span class="fore2">)</span><span class="fore14">l </span><span class="fore6">Courtyard. </span>Black marble walls stand all around in this spacious courtyard. Banners hung from the pinnacles of towers high above proclaim the Seven Truths of Evil in golden lettering on black. Lower, at <span class="fore12">eye</span> level, tapestries are hung, portraying various scenes in the history of Evil. Here a tapestry shows the Goddess of dreams bound to an iron rack as the Lord of Evil tears Her <span class="fore12">eye</span>s out. There is shown the stalagmite whereupon His followers spilled oceans of blood for His release. One shows the founding of the Naga, with Lord Sartan looking on with malevolent pride. Another shows the founding of the Apostates, Xerimor shown cutting the wings from an angel. Many more show scenes of war and duels fought by the Maldaathi. Again and again, the same faces show. Kaelin eviscerates a Mhun in one, Trunks vivisects an Atavian in another. A newly hung tapestry shows the Night of the Forgebreaker. Hwolf, Orchist, Kaelin, Mistral, Prophecy, and Yig are shown each smashing a shrine to the Smith. Carved in the floor of the courtyard is a black pentagram, which seems to leech the light from the torchlit room.<span class="fore3"> A rune like a lightning bolt has been sketched into the ground here. A rune like a rising sun has been sketched into the ground here. A statue of a fiendish dragon shelters the courtyard with outspread wings. An ornate mirror stands here, its silver face reflecting cold light. A small, well polished metal plaque is mounted on the base of a fiendish statue. A pool of opaque black water has formed at the foot of the mirror in this room. Standing still as a statue, a blood steed has fixed its fiery red </span><span class="fore12">eye</span><span class="fore3">s on some movement in the distance. A jet-black falcon glides just above, looking for prey. A stone gargoyle flies overhead on leathery, grey wings. A black, murky mist has settled here. Hands of rotting flesh and white bone push up from the ground.</span><span class="fore10"> Blade Savant </span><span class="fore12">Opponent</span><span class="fore10"> Vallah, Squire of Mhaldor is here, shrouded. Perfect to propose with. Send messages with offers, or if youd like to see it first!" </span><span class="fore2">3784h, 3278m, 17820e, 13800w </span>cexkdb- <span class="fore11">Blade Savant </span><span class="fore12">Opponent</span><span class="fore11"> Vallah, Squire of Mhaldor says, "I dunno how you writhe so fast." </span><span class="fore2">3784h, 3278m, 17820e, 13800w </span>cexkdb-<span class="fore14">say You realized I'd normally never sit there right? </span><span class="fore11">You say, "You realized I'd normally never sit there right?" </span><span class="fore2">3784h, 3278m, 17820e, 13800w </span>cexkdb- A great weight seems to have been lifted from <span class="fore12">Opponent</span>. <span class="fore2">3784h, 3278m, 17820e, 13800w </span>cexkdb- <span class="fore12">Opponent</span> takes some salve from a vial and rubs it on his skin. <span class="fore2">3784h, 3278m, 17820e, 13800w </span>cexkdb-<span class="fore14">l </span><span class="fore6">The spectator stands of the Colosseum Diabolus.</span><span class="fore12"> (</span><span class="fore2">Mhaldor</span><span class="fore12">) </span>Rows of benches, carved from great planks of bone, and trimmed with glistening hardened cartilage, stretch from wall to wall of this huge amphitheatre. In the centre are three round pools, each brimming with black fluid, slopping at the edges but never overflowing. Each ring flickers with energy, and periodically the black fluid clears to show an empty room, a dark grove, or even combat. Here spectators may sit and view the action within the colossal arena.<span class="fore3"> There are 5 </span><span class="fore12">monolith</span><span class="fore3"> sigils here. A runic totem is planted solidly in the ground. A stone gargoyle flies overhead on leathery, grey wings. Standing still as a statue, a blood steed has fixed its fiery red </span><span class="fore12">eye</span><span class="fore3">s on some movement in the distance. just sit in your preset place, I'm just out of arrows." </span><span class="fore2">3784h, 3278m, 17820e, 13800w </span>cexkdb-<span class="fore14">l </span><span class="fore6">The spectator stands of the Colosseum Diabolus.</span><span class="fore12"> (</span><span class="fore2">Mhaldor</span><span class="fore12">) </span>Rows of benches, carved from great planks of bone, and trimmed with glistening hardened cartilage, stretch from wall to wall of this huge amphitheatre. In the centre are three round pools, each brimming with black fluid, slopping at the edges but never overflowing. Each ring flickers with energy, and periodically the black fluid clears to show an empty room, a dark grove, or even combat. Here spectators may sit and view the action within the colossal arena.<span class="fore3"> There are 5 </span><span class="fore12">monolith</span><span class="fore3"> sigils here. A runic totem is planted solidly in the ground. A stone gargoyle flies overhead on leathery, grey wings. </span><span class="fore2">3784h, 3278m, 17820e, 13800w </span>cexkdb-<span class="fore14">l </span><span class="fore6">The spectator stands of the Colosseum Diabolus.</span><span class="fore12"> (</span><span class="fore2">Mhaldor</span><span class="fore12">) </span>Rows of benches, carved from great planks of bone, and trimmed with glistening hardened cartilage, stretch from wall to wall of this huge amphitheatre. In the centre are three round pools, each brimming with black fluid, slopping at the edges but never overflowing. Each ring flickers with energy, and periodically the black fluid clears to show an empty room, a dark grove, or even combat. Here spectators may sit and view the action within the colossal arena.<span class="fore3"> There are 5 </span><span class="fore12">monolith</span><span class="fore3"> sigils here. A runic totem is planted solidly in the ground. A stone gargoyle flies overhead on leathery, grey wings. Standing still as a statue, a blood steed has fixed its fiery red </span><span class="fore12">eye</span><span class="fore3">s on some movement in the distance. The statue has collapsed under the oppressive heat of the caverns. What was once a noble statue of a warrior proud and strong is now a lump of iron, and the warrior's weapons have withered, his arms hang limply down, and his back is bowed by what seems a terrible weight. The floors here are paved with gold, which has melted from the slumped figure and hardened in the cooler areas of the floor. The statue has collapsed under the oppressive heat of the caverns. What was once a noble statue of a warrior proud and strong is now a lump of iron, and the warrior's weapons have withered, his arms hang limply down, and his back is bowed by what seems a terrible weight. The floors here are paved with gold, which has melted from the slumped figure and hardened in the cooler areas of the floor. If there was a God who once cared for this room, then surely that God has forsaken it.<span class="fore3"> A runic totem is planted solidly in the ground. The room is oppressively hot, and the walls are scorching hot to the touch. The stone here is black basalt mixed with glossy obsidian streaks.<span class="fore3"> A runic totem is planted solidly in the ground. A statue of a monstrous Baalzadeen fills the room with its bestial form. A small, well polished metal plaque is mounted on the base of a monstrous statue. A stone gargoyle flies overhead on leathery, grey wings. The room is oppressively hot, and the walls are scorching hot to the touch. The stone here is black basalt mixed with glossy obsidian streaks.<span class="fore3"> A runic totem is planted solidly in the ground. A statue of a monstrous Baalzadeen fills the room with its bestial form. A small, well polished metal plaque is mounted on the base of a monstrous statue. A stone gargoyle flies overhead on leathery, grey wings. Standing still as a statue, a blood steed has fixed its fiery red </span><span class="fore12">eye</span><span class="fore3">s on some movement in the distance. A jet-black falcon glides just above, looking for prey. The room is oppressively hot, and the walls are scorching hot to the touch. The stone here is black basalt mixed with glossy obsidian streaks.<span class="fore3"> A runic totem is planted solidly in the ground. A statue of a monstrous Baalzadeen fills the room with its bestial form. A small, well polished metal plaque is mounted on the base of a monstrous statue. A stone gargoyle flies overhead on leathery, grey wings. Standing still as a statue, a blood steed has fixed its fiery red </span><span class="fore12">eye</span><span class="fore3">s on some movement in the distance. The room is oppressively hot, and the walls are scorching hot to the touch. The stone here is black basalt mixed with glossy obsidian streaks.<span class="fore3"> A runic totem is planted solidly in the ground. A statue of a monstrous Baalzadeen fills the room with its bestial form. A small, well polished metal plaque is mounted on the base of a monstrous statue. A stone gargoyle flies overhead on leathery, grey wings. Standing still as a statue, a blood steed has fixed its fiery red </span><span class="fore12">eye</span><span class="fore3">s on some movement in the distance. A jet-black falcon glides just above, looking for prey. A stinking noxious cloud floats here.
